required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: A Prospective, Randomized, Double-Blind, Placebo-Controlled Trial to Assess the Safety and Tolerability of Influenza Virus Vaccine,(CAIV-T) in Healthy Infants
clinical_study.official_title: A Prospective, Randomized, Double-Blind, Placebo-Controlled Trial to Assess the Safety and Tolerability of Influenza Virus Vaccine, Trivalent, Types A & B, Live Cold Adapted (CAIV-T) in Healthy Infants

collaborator.agency: Wyeth is now a wholly owned subsidiary of Pfizer

brief_summary.textblock: Trial to compare the safety and tolerability of one and two doses of influenza virus vaccine.

detailed_description.textblock: The objective of this study was to compare the safety and tolerability of one and two doses of influenza virus vaccine, trivalent, types A and B, live cold-adapted liquid (CAIV-T) with placebo when administered intranasally to healthy infants aged 6 < 24 weeks.

primary_outcome.measure: - To compare the safety and tolerability of one and two doses of influenza virus vaccine, trivalent,(CAIV-T) with placebo when administered intranasally
